page.title: 13The Viewpark Glen
page.content: The 'Glen' is what is left of large estates which belonged to two mansion houses which are demolished. The Red Burn and North Calder Water run through the land which has many plantations of different kinds of trees. There are many species of wild plants and some wildlife. Years ago people went down the Glen for outings and picnics. A lot of dumping and vandalism made the Glen a poor place for a wh- ile. Now there are workers cleaning up the land and making things look better. Money is being spent to make paths and safer bridges. At the top end near the main road is a new in- terpretive centre for visitors. A full time ranger helps keep vandals out and gives people information. He has junior rangers to help him. Ben, in our class, is one of them.
